formattedAddress: 62 Cooper Sq # 2, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 62 Cooper Sq # 2, New York, NY 10003-7111, USA

originalText.text: Wardrobe paradise... an endless amount of pieces from the 1990s, Y2K years, and modern collections. Impossible to see every piece in one day of digging!  Knowledgeable staff on past and present references, who know their massive inventory really well.  As for the comments below on the staff: yes, they are all business.  I wouldn't call them rude tho.  They are extremely busy most days (you'll see well-know stylists and their assistants scurrying around in a frenzy for a last minute pull), and in the chaos I could see some thinking the staff is rude...but nah, that's the stress of deadlines and the making in the magic.

originalText.text: Literally cannot rave about Albright enough... I've been coming to them for over 6 years and it's my happy place! The fashion is beyond- always something new to see and forever inspiring me. Patty, Lindsey, Danielle-the whole team makes pulling a breeze and I'm always so excited to see them. 5+ stars!

originalText.text:
I‚Äôve been a fashion stylist in NYC for 20 years and Albright is my absolute go-to for celebrity dressing, high end advertising and photo shoots. They always have to most current runway pieces and a very well curated collection of relevant new and classic designers.
Albright has always been part of NY fashion fabric.
Eric N

originalText.text: Ok.  But pilgrim on Orchard is way better curated and pricing is reasonable.  This place is ATTITUDE. The real chuck is so obnoxious and a know it all plain Jane disaster.   Like Suzy Menkes or Glenda Bailey.  Horse faces nasty
